comments.author: John
comments.content: I've got to try this one. Our CSA got me cooking a LOT of chard early last summer, and I was longing for new recipes. The one thing I might do differently is to toss in the chopped stems first, and add the leaves only for the last bit of the cooking (the last 1-2 min, maybe?). That way it requires a little less babysitting, and you can adjust how wilted you want the leaves.

comments.author: Chris of Stumptown
comments.content:
Usually I am not motivated to cook with the ribs unless they are going to be cooked with the greens.

I do however save them for stocks... toss them in a freezer bag with leek tops, asparagus ends, mushroom stems, parsley stems etc.  Amazing what you can get from stuff most ppl toss in the garbage.
